DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Excision Biologic Sample Preservation Procedure Elapsed Time Minute Duration
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The duration of time between biospecimen collection to processing or preservation, measured in minutes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Excision Biologic Sample Preservation Procedure Elapsed Time
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins._Procedures utilized to save organic substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state._The interval between two reference points in time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
